captions.text: [music]
magikyul in England asks how we met, how we fell in love,
and any funny stories that happening while we were dating.
Oh boy.  OH BOY!
Ok well we met in our third year of university at the University of Toronto (REPRESENT!)
in a Romantic Poetry and Prose class.
Except it was like Romantic with a Big R,
which means the Romantic Era, which is totally depressing.
And I remember when I first saw Martina in that class
Like, I was instantly drawn to her, cuz she was still in her Rock and Gothy stage,
Ohh I'm embarrassed!
She had lightning bolt earrings and she had chains on all over her pants,
and she had her hair slicked back and I thought
MAN THAT GIRL IS HAWT!  ANG!
Is that what you did?  You were Korean?
Well, I didn't ANG at her, but I did Ang in my mind.
And I remember we were having a discussion about a poem
that had a ruined castle in it
OH NO THIS IS EMBARRASSING!
And Martina raised her hand and she said that it reminded her
of a scene of Lord of the Rings, and, at that moment I knew…
…this is the woman for me.  OH YEAH!
So embarrassing!
But it was that really amazing scene with Gandalf
when he's fighting the Balrog
and he was like YOU SHALL NOT PASS
and he puts it in and he's like pew pew pew pew pew
But, anyways, I thought that Martina was really hot
and I really wanted to get with her,
But I had a boyfriend!
womp womp womp womp
Super womb womb womb.  And I didn't notice Simon at all!
WOMP WOMP WOMP WOMP!
Sorry Honey Bunny!  You weren't my Honey Bunny yet,
At the time, though, I didn't know that she had a boyfriend,
so I started talking to her in class and after class
and tried to be friends with her
and then we had a quiz coming up for that class,
so I decided - since I knew her last name -
that I would find her phone number in the phone book.
Because that's what phone books are for.
Wow, pretty amazing, right?
I know!  And luckily, Martina's last name isn't very popular,
so there are only three entries in the phone book for it,
and I called it, and the first one was a great success,
HUZZAH!
Ok so I picked up the phone, Hello?
Hi, this is Simon from your Romantic Poetry and Prose class,
Oh, hey Simon! [HOW DID HE GET MY NUMBER?!]
[SMOOTH!]
Anyhow, since we have a quiz coming up,
I was wondering if you wanted to get together
and study for it at the library,
[VERY SMOOTH]
[Oh, well, I have a boyfriend, but Simon is really smart]
[and he wants to meet at the library, so he probably can't be interested in me]
Yeah, ok, sounds great!  Let's meet up and study!
[I didn't hear her whisper into the phone that she had a boyfriend.  That's ok]
Smooth
[I MEAN DAMN! DID I SAY SMOOTH OUT LOUD IN THE PHONE?!]
OH NO HANG UP AHHHH!
Anyhow, we wound up meeting at the library afterwards
and we did a lot of studying and talking,
and turns out that that's when she told me that she had a boyfriend,
AY HOO!
Forever alone,
We wound up becoming very good friends instead,
So we were just really close friends for that year
and then by the end of the year
I tried to hook Simon up with one of my friends
And, huh, sorry about that
And when I tried to hook him up with one of my friends
my friend was interested in two guys, Simon and another guy
and I got really upset cuz I'm like
"Simon's this really great guy!  He's so smart and he's so nice!
and he's so awesome and he's so sexy!"
I didn't say that [but I thought it]
Anyways, I said all these great things about Simon,
and then I realized, oh oh: I think I have a crush on Simon.
SMOOTH
So then I decided that it's probably about time
that I break up with my boyfriend
if i have a crush on another guy.
So then I ended things with my boyfriend,
and soon afterwards Simon and I started dating.
HUZZAH!
But, it was kind of a secret, because we were originally friends,
so we didn't want to weird out our friend group
by suddenly becoming a couple.
So because we were keeping this a secret from our friends
a lot of funny situations came about from it,
and our favourite funny moment happened when we were at our friend's loft.
!!! OH YAH!  Ok so,
we were really competitive when we started dating,
So we were all in the same room together,
and our friends went downstairs to the kitchen to get some food,
So Simon and I got in this, like, tickle fight,
except we couldn't laugh out loud,
because then our friends would be suspicious like "what's going on up there?"
So we were trying to be quiet, but we were tickling each other,
so it looked like this [AWKWARD SILENT GIGGLES]
And then the couch exploded.
We totally broke the couch.
It was a…it didn't totally explode,
it's the leg that kind of snapped off,
So we were like "OMG How can we possibly explain this?"
So we wound up propping it up with the broken leg underneath,
so that it stood up, but barely, but we didn't sit on it afterwards,
We just separated and went back to reading books
as if nothing happened like this
[pretentious music and faux-pretentious lines]
Our friends came back upstairs and jumped to sit on the couch,
and the couch imploded.
And our reactions were like
OMG!  OH NOEZ!  WHAT HAPPENED?!
What's going on?  That's too bad.
Why would you break that?  You guys are reckless!
Jumping on that couch!  Jeez!
Anyhow, two months into dating we knew that we were gonna get married to one another
It was, like, 100% sure.
So what wound up doing so that we didn't freak everybody out
instead of proposing right away we got two promise rings
and we wore them on our pinky fingers
So with those promise rings we knew that we would actually change them into our wedding band
and these are actually, this bottom one here:
this is our promise ring, yeah.
This is it.
and it was on this finger here and we had it resized to be our wedding band.
Now what's really special about these is that
combined, both of our wedding bands costs only $300.
They don't have to cost a lot of money because
all that matters is the actual fact that we know what these mean.
It's not the worth of them, it's the specialness of them.
Ok, way to sound like a card Simon,
shut up SHUT UP!
I'm sentimental!
Yes you are honey bunny!
Anyways, Simon had an amazing proposal planned for me
He completely surprised me.  It was epic.
However: I don't believe that was part of the question.
Did you read that in the question?
No.  Sorry guise!
It's over!
GONG!
Intoxicatingly sexy music!

comments.author: Zainab Anwari

comments.text:
Everything cute and stuff, but...breaking up randomly with someone isn't 
really nice. She didn't really have a reason to break up, but only thought 
of herself. Sorry if I am not approval of this, but Martina didn't show any 
respect whatsoever. Then again, American culture, different culture...﻿
comments.author: Domy Coppola

comments.text:
+Domy Coppola 
Martina fell out of love for her ex. and she never realized it until she 
fell in love with Simon. Just like falling in love with someone, people 
don't realized it until something that makes them realizes, correct? It 
wasn't random nor she thought of herself. The thing is that you don't 
understand or believe that people can fall OUT of love. 
I used to have your mentality that people shouldn't date another without 
loving them first or making love with someone that they don't love. 
However, my mentally changed because people learn news things about the 
person they like/love with time. 
- - - For example, let's say that you love this guy and he feels the same, 
but over time being together, you realize little things that bothers the 
heck out of you, or that his personality changes and such or vise-versa. 
That is when people start to fall out of love. Would you rather have a 
boyfriend that will respect you and tell you that he no longer feels the 
same about you or date you because of pity? Or date you while dating other 
girls? 


*Ps. Hun, people fall out of love and you have to be understand of this.* 
Pss. Personally, I think she did the right thing by breaking it off. It 
shows that she respect her ex because she chose not to cheat on her ex 
behind his back or two timed their relationship.
comments.author: Jenny Feng

comments.text:
When your "dating" someone your courting them and basically figuring out if 
your compatible and should take the relationship to the next level. In 
American that's what we do. She didn't say she was in love with the guy or 
living with him, but she was dating someone, not assuming how serious that 
relationship was. In Simons video he said they all hung out and he actually 
supported their relationship for a while, then upon forming a bond with 
Simon and connecting with him as just friends for a year realized she 
actually had a connection that was more than what she had with her 
boyfriend, so out of respect for him before anything began with Simon she 
ended the relationship with the boyfriend. Obviously they weren't serious 
or Simon wouldn't be her Husband what 6,7 years later? I think she made a 
respectful choice to not cheat and to also follow her heart and not stay in 
a relationship while her heart was leading her to someone else.
comments.author: BlueCherry Mama

comments.text: +ohshesmiles  Tell her
comments.author: Domy Coppola

comments.text: Wow, you're naive.
comments.author: ohshesmiles

comments.text:
+Domy Coppola
You can really, really like someone without loving them. I know you're not 
meaning to but you're coming off condescending. I don't think she said she 
loved him, I don't think she can love him. You don't just dump someone you 
love. Love is once in a lifetime. I personally cannot understand why you 
would think that would even be a thing.
comments.author: LeDubKitty

comments.text:
As I said, if she loved him, she did wrong, very wrong; if she didn't love 
him, and she dated him the way you just said it, then it supposedly " 
okay". However, no disrespect intended, I just expressed my opinion, I 
didn't know I couldn't do that...Plus, I did , in fact, not ask anyone to 
have a mutual opinion. I therefore invite you to comprehend the fact that I 
wasn't insulting anyone, my statement was a mere observation, led by the 
fact that I cannot understand, nor do I tollerate the fact that people date 
without having some kind of sentimental driven feelings. Just that.
comments.author: Domy Coppola

comments.text:
+Domy Coppola
Yes you are being very biased. You need to understand that not everyone 
thinks like you. Where I live you date someone to find out if you both are 
compatible enough to fall in love. How else do you fall in love with 
someone? Insulting someone with your biased opinions then asking others to 
see where you come from is disrespectful. You cannot preach disrespect 
while being disrespectful. And again, you cannot be in LOVE with someone, 
genuine true love and have crushes. So therefore she wasn't in love. I 
mean, even if you could, you wouldn't leave someone for that crush. I feel 
like you're completely unjustly judging her based off very little 
information.
comments.author: LeDubKitty

comments.text:
I am not upset, not at all, but try to respect what I feel: In my life, ( 
23 years and 1/2) I have never seen someone dating another person without 
LOVING that person. Why would you be with that person in the first place? 
That's what I mean: people date randomly, for no reason, coming and leaving 
whenever they feel like doing it. That is morally so wrong. Now tell me I 
should get more 2015ified, and need to see things as they are nowadays, but 
I can't get past the " dating but not loving"thing. Why would you date 
someone , if you don't LOVE that person? Same thing goes to sleeping with 
someone. I don't how people can actually FIRST sleep with someone and THEN 
define he/she as their girlfriend, and what's worse in this is: they sleep 
together, and they don't even love each other! Holy crap. I may be too 
biased here, but that is just my opinion, and for me, if she LOVED that bf 
she had before Simon, then she was pretty disrespectful; if she was just 
dating him, then , I guess, it's " normal" , if none of them were really 
into it, It's ok. But don't say " I love you" if you just go and love 
someone else. IT'S ABSURD.
comments.author: Domy Coppola

comments.text:
+Domy Coppola
I do understand where you are coming from... at a degree. She never stated 
she was in love with the other guy. And I agree if you love someone you 
cannot fall in love with someone else, even if you tried. (I'm in that 
boat, never look at anyone else) But before I met my partner I was able to 
have CRUSHES on guys while I was with other guys that I didn't LOVE. We are 
humans, we do that. You don't fall in love with everyone you like or date. 
And you cannot help falling in love with someone. It literally just 
happens. It's not something you can go out and control. Martina didn't 
realize she liked Simon at all. She didn't sit there and fantasize about 
him, she did the mature thing and dumped the other guy. Because she is 
human she fell for someone else. But because she loves Simon I bet you she 
never fell for anyone else after him. And you may have your opinion, you 
have that right. But you are literally calling her disrespectful and in a 
way insulting her for her decision. You're getting upset because other 
people don't agree with you, but you're doing the same thing to her.
comments.author: LeDubKitty

comments.text:
Plus, yes , this was cheating. How else do you want to consider it? But 
then agai, this is my opinion. No one has to agree.
comments.author: Domy Coppola

comments.text:
Y'all don't understand what I'm saying. It's wrong, plain wrong, the 
principle is wrong to the very bone. If I am with someone that I SHOULD BE 
LOVING, why fall in love with someone else? Where is the respect here? I 
don't understand how you can possibly fall for someone else while being 
with another person.
comments.author: Domy Coppola

comments.text:
Not even! That proves she has complete respect for the other person. Having 
a crush on someone else while in a relationship is wrong and to most people 
it's considered cheating. She probably thought "Wow. If I have a crush on 
this guy I obviously don't like him as much as I thought I do." Staying 
with him would be living a lie, in a way.
comments.author: LeDubKitty

comments.author: indigothecat

comments.text:
Well honestly, I was going with the denotative meaning of the word, (any 
preconceived opinion or feeling, either favorable or unfavorable) using 
some examples of the connotative meaning to show someone who expressed an 
inability to see how a comment such as yours might be seen as rude. I'm 
sorry you ended up being the example. But anyway- we should get back to the 
viewing. :)
comments.author: Megumi Goose

comments.text:
I still think prejudice is a bit too strong a word and has much more 
negative connotations than apply here.
I just don't think sexuality is a big deal, sure if I met him personally I 
wouldn't blurt out "I thought you were gay mate'' the first time we met 
because of politeness and social convention... but as a youtube comment, 
it's not so bad :)
comments.author: jjproudfoot

comments.text:
It all comes down to prejudice.  What you said didn't really have much 
harm- may not have even hurt Simon's feelings- but it was rude. I was only 
explaining how by using definite examples of social rule breaking to make 
clear that it was the assuming that was rude and not necessarily the 
assumption.
comments.author: Megumi Goose

comments.text:
I have to disagree with you tbh, Simon is pretty camp so I assumed he was 
gay, simple as that.
Equating me to a racist or misogynist is ridiculous.
+Megumi Goose
comments.author: jjproudfoot

comments.text:
+Ίρις Γεωλιέζου
It's not about homosexuality being good or bad. There are just some things 
one shouldn't assume about people. It's like looking at someone who is 
black and assuming they're involved in a gang, or being surprised a woman 
could start her own business. It's just plain and simple prejudice. No body 
wants to be living under a label that isn't their own, and it can be 
annoying when people constantly put you in that stereotype. How annoying 
would it be if people kept commenting on how they didn't see your 
relationship with your spouse romantic in anyway at all? That's why it's 
rude.
comments.author: Megumi Goose

comments.text:
I also thought he was gay. And why is it rude? Unless you mean that being

comments.author: Jennifer Naija

comments.text:
Well, they knew each other as friends first and to take the leap from 
friends to couple is a very big step and requires a lot of confidence. I 
knew right off the bat that I was going to marry this guy I knew and he 
proved it to me because for two years as a friend, he never looked at 
another girl. I think the most important thing is that you have the WILL to 
keep the relationship going. You have to have the mentality that even if 
things get super rocky, that you'll stick it out.
comments.author: kagnomi

comments.text:
After seeing their Draw My Life, I knew that these two were born for each 
other and that whatever kids they have will be extremely lucky and blessed 
(and I hope they have lots of babies because we need more awesome people in 
this world). However, I'm a bit worried - Martina can easily dislocate her 
body parts so will she be ok if she get pregnant and gives birth? >.<

comments.text:
Um truthfully it was because of my boyfriend. Since I was little I wanted 
to be an astronaut then reality hit me and for a couple of years I thought 
I would make a good nurse and then I realized i neither have the dexterity 
not the guts to handle it. Then boyfriend who has friend at the time told 
me he wanted to be that since he was little and chem professor brought in 
people from the navy that operated reactors and then I just jumped into it. 
Worked out for the best though, I love my major!
